name: jquery-cross-domain-requests
description: Make cross domain requests using jQuery and YQL.
author: Ionică Bizău <bizauionica@gmail.com> (http://ionicabizau.net)

description.p: Before start to use it, maybe you want see it working. If you want this, choose one of the following suggestions:

ul: [Index1.html](http://htmlpreview.github.com/?https://raw.github.com/IonicaBizau/jQuery-cross-domain-requests/master/index1.html): Only the basic part. It gets the Google.com HTML code.

[Index2.html](http://htmlpreview.github.com/?https://raw.github.com/IonicaBizau/jQuery-cross-domain-requests/master/index2.html): The basic part, but you can input an URL where you want to make the request.
[Index3.html](http://htmlpreview.github.com/?https://raw.github.com/IonicaBizau/jQuery-cross-domain-requests/master/index3.html): This contains nice CSS styles: border, shadow, and more.

description.p: Download the Javascript files from `js` folder, and import them into your HTML file.
For getting the HTML code of your web page, you will just call:

content: url: 'http://google.com', // Or your web page link

description.p: This application uses YQL, which allows us to make cross-domain GET requests!
